turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Chicago Traction Wars.
turn.1: What was the Chicago Traction Wars?
turn.2: Chicago Traction Wars The Chicago Traction Wars was a political conflict which took place in Chicago primarily from the mid-1890s through the early 1910s.
turn.3: What was the main battle in the war?
turn.4: It concerned the franchise and ownership of streetcar lines.
turn.5: Did the war lead to any other battles?
turn.6: At the time it was one of the dominant political issues in the city and was a central issue of several mayoral elections and shaped the tenures of several mayors, particularly those of Carter Harrison Jr. and Edward Fitzsimmons Dunne.
turn.8: Chicago awarded its first street railway franchises in 1856.
turn.10: Early on, dozens of streetcar companies arose.
turn.11: Did any remain after the war?
turn.12: However, by the 1890s mergers and acquisitions had left only a handful.
